text: Anthony Gregory Brown (born November 21, 1961) is an American lawyer and politician who is the Attorney General of Maryland since 2023. He was the U.S. Representative for Maryland's 4th congressional district from 2017 to 2023. He was the eighth Lieutenant Governor of Maryland, from 2007 to 2015."Anthony G. Brown, Lt. Governor ". Political biography. Maryland State Archives . Retrieved February 14, 2007."O'Malley/Brown in Maryland gubernatorial race". The Baltimore Sun. Retrieved January 10, 2007. Not available online as of January 13, 2007. In 2014, Brown ran unsuccessfully for governor, losing to Republican Larry Hogan. In October 2021, Brown announced that he will not run for reelection to the House in 2022 because he will run for Maryland Attorney General. He won the Democratic primary on July 19, 2022. He defeated Republican lawyer Michael Peroutka in the general election on November 8, 2022, becoming Maryland's first Black attorney general. ==References== Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Lieutenant Governors of Maryland Category:United States representatives from Maryland Category:Politicians from New York (state) Category:Lawyers from Maryland Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from New York (state) Category:African-American politicians Category:People from Huntington, New York
